title: Hypotheses
text: What are the Null Hypothesis $$H_0$$ and Alternative Hypothesis in this context?

hintAnswer: $$H_0$$: The actual college majors of graduating females fit the distribution of their expected majors
title: Null Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_0$$: The actual college majors of graduating females fit the distribution of their expected majors
$$H_0$$: The actual college majors of graduating females do not fit the distribution of their expected majors

hintAnswer: $$H_a$$: The actual college majors of graduating females do not fit the distribution of their expected majors
title: Alternative Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_a$$: The actual college majors of graduating females fit the distribution of their expected majors
$$H_a$$: The actual college majors of graduating females do not fit the distribution of their expected majors

title: Consider what distribution is most appropriate to use in this problem.
What is the degree of freedom?
Compute the $$p-value$$.
text: Round the answer to four decimal places.

title: Compare with the significant level $$0.05$$.
text: At 5% significance level, \alpha $$=$$ $$0.05$$. For this data, P < \alpha. Reject the null hypothesis.

title: Interpret the Result
text: At the 5% level of significance, from the data, there is insufficient evidence to conclude that the distribution of actual college majors of graduating females do not fit the distribution of their expected majors.
